alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 10 at 2:21PM MST until March 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches possible, with locally higher amounts in the Upper Cottonwoods, Provo area mountains and western Uintas. Winds could gust as high as 90 mph, locally stronger on exposed ridgetops. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains South of I-80, Western Uinta Mountains and Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx.
